page.title: 03TWEED'S FAIR RIVER
page.content:
"Tweed's fair river,broad and deep"
This quotation is from{Sir Walter {Scott's}poem{Marmion}and the{River {Tweed}enters our block at Lowwood estate and leaves our block at Millmount farm.As it flows through our block the river has several interesting features.{The Bottle {Bridge }at Gattonside is so called because it is shaped like a bottle. Only one line of traffic can get through at a time.Further down there is a weir which is a man made dip in the river.Fishermen come from miles around to fish in certain parts of the {River Tweed.}The River Tweed is famous for salmon.There are several salmon patches in our block with names like Ellwyn Pool,Megs Hole and The Whirls. The Swing Bridge is a Bailey Bridge connecting Gattonside with Melrose.
